bingo.game.go_to_lobby: %s to go back to the lobby.
bingo.game.go_to_lobby.hint: Hint: You can use the command %s at any time manually to return to the lobby as well.
bingo.lobby.card_generation.from_seed.in: %s to receieve the command for setting the seed. Add the numeric seed at the very end of the command.
bingo.lobby.card_generation.from_seed.ex: The seed determines which items generate on the bingo card and where you spawn. You can use this for example for competitive races, where everyone is using the same seed.
bingo.lobby.card_generation.start_game.a: You cannot start a new game without generating a new card.
bingo.lobby.card_generation.start_game.n: You cannot start a game without having generated a Bingo Card.
bingo.lobby.settings.player.tutorial.par:
These settings allow you to manipulate with which items and effects the player spawns.
All potion effects are permanent.
There are already some pre-configured presets you can use by clicking the “Select/Preview Config” sign to the right.
To make your own configuration, simply change the items in your own inventory or drink a potion to add a permanent status effect. To get rid of your effects, use milk.

Stand on the chiseled quartz block to gain creative mode for easy access to all the items.
If you are an operator, or are playing singleplayer, you can also use the /give and /effect commands.
Don't forget to save your configuration when you are done - otherwise it won't be saved or selected.
bingo.lobby.settings.player.save.title: Save Player Configuration
bingo.lobby.settings.player.save.new.exp:
Set the name for your new configuration by renaming the nametag you just received using the anvil underneath this sign.
When you are done, simply drop the nametag.
In case your inventory is full, you can temporarily drop something in front of the anvil to pick it back up when the nametag is inside of the anvil's gui.
bingo.lobby.settings.player.save.overwri: Successfully overwrote configuration “%s” with new settings.
bingo.lobby.settings.player.load.title: Load Player Configuration
bingo.lobby.settings.player.configuratio: Night Vision + Water Breathing + Depth Strider
bingo.lobby.settings.more_coming.menu.ti: Do you want to change future settings?
bingo.lobby.settings.more_coming.menu.no: Good decision. Who knows, maybe these settings are awful.
bingo.lobby.settings.automatic_pregen.in:
By default, terrain is pre-generated around spawn as soon as you hit the "Start Game" sign. When turning this setting on, pre-generation will automatically start 5 seconds after generating a new card. In case a new card is generated, the timer will restart, and a possible ungoing generation will be interrupted.
Note that this may cause lag in the lobby while it is ongoing, making some functionallity in the lobby slow to react and unresponsive in some cases.
bingo.lobby.preferences.menu.main.title: Change Preferences
bingo.lobby.preferences.menu.main.card_p: Changes where on the screen the Bingo card is displayed
bingo.lobby.preferences.menu.card_pos.le: Postions the Bingo card left of the hotbar.
bingo.lobby.preferences.menu.card_pos.ri: Postions the Bingo card right of the hotbar.

This setting requires more information about your Minecraft settings.
Please take a look at your Attack Indicator setting in Options -> Video Settings and choose one of the following:
Adds an extra space to make room for the attack indicator next to the hotbar.
Positions the Bingo card directly next to the hotbar.
bingo.lobby.preferences.warning16_9: Only works properly on a 16:9 display.
bingo.lobby.preferences.menu.card_pos.le: Postions the Bingo card on the left edge of the screen.

This setting requires more information about your Minecraft settings.
Please take a look at your GUI Scale setting in Options -> Video Settings. In case it is set to auto, please cycle the setting to find the scale auto is using.
Please choose one of the following:
bingo.lobby.preferences.menu.card_pos.ri: Postions the Bingo card on the right edge of the screen.
bingo.lobby.preferences.gui_scale.hover: Aligns the Bingo card to the left edge for GUI Scale %s.
bingo.lobby.tutorial.goals.introduction:
In Minecraft Bingo, there are different kinds of goals to go for.

When planning your run, you should decide what to go for beforehand.

The following pages detail all the goals that are detected.
bingo.lobby.tutorial.goals.bingo.heading: Bingo
bingo.lobby.tutorial.goals.bingo:
For a Bingo, get all of the 5 items in any of the rows, columns or diagonals.

For considering which items to go for, you can use the marking functionality on the card in the lobby using left click and right click.
bingo.lobby.tutorial.goals.blackout.head: Blackout
bingo.lobby.tutorial.goals.blackout:
A blackout is simply getting all of the 25 items.

Try to be as efficient as possible, getting items from similar sources together and smelt while you are doing other stuff in the area.
bingo.lobby.tutorial.goals.20_no_bingo:
Get 20 items without achieving any Bingo.

When planning, try to think about which items to avoid in order to achieve this goal. Beware of items you might pick up accidentally, such as arrows when fighting skeletons.
bingo.lobby.tutorial.goals.multiple_bing:
For this goal, you need to get multiple bingos at once.

You do that by getting 4 items in intersecting rows, columns or diagonals and then get the item at the intersection last.
This includes double, triple and quadruple Bingo.
bingo.lobby.tutorial.game_info.introduct: This book contains some general information about the game. There are some custom world generation changes, which are also detailed in here.
bingo.lobby.tutorial.game_info.general: All the items in the game require the exact variant as pictured. All items that look the same count (ie, an enchanted book does not require any specific enchant, but a red bed requires the specific color.)
bingo.lobby.tutorial.game_info.world_gen: Minecraft Bingo uses some worldgeneration customizations.
Biome sizes are decreased to enable easier exploration. Due to some limitations, you might notice other differences in the biome layout as well.
In order to make dungeons reasonable to find in a fast paced Bingo game, the rates of dungeons are increased by a factor of 12.5, making it easy to find them in any given run.

The cave frequency got slightly increased (from 1/7 in vanilla to 1/6).

Furthermore, ocean biomes do not generate any flooded caves in this map.
Mineshafts turned out to be too overpowered, giving easy access to lots of chests. Thus they are disabled in Bingo.

All stone variants like DiorITE, GranITE and AndesITE are completely removed from the generation in this version.
This is done to reduce inventory clutter.

There is a dimension setting in place that lets you see in the dark similarily to the vanilla nether.
This works without night vision while you still are able to tell darkness apart from light to some degree.
bingo.category.gold_and_ruined_portal: Items from ruined portal or made from gold
